column4: Hi, does anyone know if its at all possible for me to install windows 7 after ubuntu with 3 primary partitions?
I use gparted to make 50gb of unallocated space but when I tried to install windows 7 on it, it says that all the primary partitions were used
perhps ask in windows it may be a quirk of the installer.. you could pastebin the output of fdisk -l for us. Ubuntu does NOT need to be on primary partitions.
do I need install something for that command to work? I am on minimal install
run fdisk and see if its installed..
it shows a list of usage commands/options
so check/pastebin  outut of sudo fdisk -l
you have 4 primary partitiosn on sda.  and 1 on sdb - so what was the actual issue?
when I try to install windows 7 on sdb it says the amount of this type of partition is at its max
make a ntfs partiton and see if the installer figures it out perhaps.
ok, I will give that a try. thank you
that sdb1 was my thumb drive partition. the 50gb of unallocated space is actually on sda
my root/swap and home are all primary partitions
is there anyway to change them?
i guess i'll back up my stuff and give it a shot then =D
